results.name: Number A(n,k) of n length words over k-ary alphabet, where neighboring letters are neighbors in the alphabet; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Equivalently, the number of walks of length n-1 on the path graph P_k. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 17 2017
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: A(5,3) = 12: there are 12 words of length 5 over 3-ary alphabet {a,b,c}, where neighboring letters are neighbors in the alphabet: ababa, ababc, abcba, abcbc, babab, babcb, bcbab, bcbcb, cbaba, cbabc, cbcba, cbcbc.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1,
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i == 0, Sum[b[n-1, j, k], {j, 1, k}], If[i>1, b[n-1, i-1, k], 0] + If[i<k, b[n-1, i+1, k], 0]]]; A[n_, k_] := b[n, 0, k]; Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 19 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
